Training DNNs involves minimizing a loss function that measures the discrepancy between the ground truth labels and the model‚Äôs predictions. Training is carried out by backpropagation, w...

item.description: Today, in partnership with EMBL‚Äôs European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI), we‚Äôre now releasing predicted structures for nearly all catalogued proteins known to science, which will expand the Alph...
item.content:encoded: Today, in partnership with EMBL‚Äôs European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI), we‚Äôre now releasing predicted structures for nearly all catalogued proteins known to science, which will expand the AlphaFold DB by over 200x - from nearly 1 million structures to over 200 million structures - with the potential to dramatically increase our understanding of biology.

item.title: Look and Talk: Natural Conversations with Google Assistant | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Tuan Anh Nguyen, Staff Software Engineer, Google Assistant, and Sourish Chaudhuri, Staff Software Engineer, Google Research In natural conversations, we don't say people's names every time w...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Tuan Anh Nguyen, Staff Software Engineer, Google Assistant, and Sourish Chaudhuri, Staff Software Engineer, Google Research In natural conversations, we don't say people's names every time we speak to each other. Instead, we rely on contextual signaling mechanisms to initiate conversations, and eye contact is often all it takes. Google Assistant, now available in more than 95 countries and over 29 languages, has primarily relied on a hotword mechanism ("Hey Google" or ‚ÄúOK Google‚Äù) to h...

Is Domain Knowledge Important for Machine Learning? | KDnuggets
item.description: If you incorporate domain knowledge into your architecture and your model, it can make it a lot easier to explain the results, both to yourself and to an outside viewer. Every bit of domain knowledge ...
item.content:encoded: If you incorporate domain knowledge into your architecture and your model, it can make it a lot easier to explain the results, both to yourself and to an outside viewer. Every bit of domain knowledge can serve as a stepping stone through the black box of a machine learning model.

item.description: Posted by Maxim Tabachnyk, Staff Software Engineer and Stoyan Nikolov, Senior Engineering Manager, Google Research The increasing complexity of code poses a key challenge to productivity in software e...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Maxim Tabachnyk, Staff Software Engineer and Stoyan Nikolov, Senior Engineering Manager, Google Research The increasing complexity of code poses a key challenge to productivity in software engineering. Code completion has been an essential tool that has helped mitigate this complexity in integrated development environments (IDEs). Conventionally, code completion suggestions are implemented with rule-based semantic engines (SEs), which typically have access to the full repository and un...

item.content:encoded: Graph theory measures may provide powerful means of understanding brain function at both the global and regional levels. These measures may be particularly useful when it comes to understanding network changes in the brain that occur due to disease.

item.content:encoded: Data is everywhere but only data is not sufficient to reap the benefits that come with it. It needs to be organized to enable the organizations to make more informed business decisions. In this article, we will learn what are the various benefits of being a data-first enterprise and using the data in developing a business intelligence solution.

item.title: Training Generalist Agents with Multi-Game Decision Transformers | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Winnie Xu, Student Researcher and Kuang-Huei Lee, Software Engineer, Google Research, Brain Team Current deep reinforcement learning (RL) methods can train specialist artificial agents that ...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Winnie Xu, Student Researcher and Kuang-Huei Lee, Software Engineer, Google Research, Brain Team Current deep reinforcement learning (RL) methods can train specialist artificial agents that excel at decision-making on various individual tasks in specific environments, such as Go or StarCraft. However, little progress has been made to extend these results to generalist agents that would not only be capable of performing many different tasks, but also upon a variety of environments with ...

item.content:encoded: Posted by Akib Uddin, Product Manager and Andrew Sellergren, Software Engineer, Google Health Every year, nearly a billion chest X-ray (CXR) images are taken globally to aid in the detection and management of health conditions ranging from collapsed lungs to infectious diseases. Generally, CXRs are cheaper and more accessible than other forms of medical imaging. However, existing challenges continue to impede the optimal use of CXRs. For example, in some areas, trained radiologists that can accu...
